intro: Calyptranthes karwinskyana, commonly known as the Karwinsky's calyptranthes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and other ericaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
